org.gridlab.gridsphere.services.security.gss
Interface CredentialContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
CredentialContextImpl
public interface CredentialContext

Provides a persistent context for GSS credentials. A credential context describes a credential that belongs to a portal user. A user can have multiple credential contexts but no two credential contexts can have the same distinguished name (DN). That is, each credential context describes the use of a credential with a unique DN within a portal.

Credential contexts are activated by supplying a credential and will maintain a handle to that credential until the credential expires. Credential contexts are created and maintained by the credential manager service. Moreover, credential contexts can contain zero or more resource mappings. That is, credential contexts can be used to describe for which resources a credential may be used in a portal.

See Also:
GSSCredential, CredentialManagerService

getFileName

public java.lang.String getFileName()
Returns the name of the file containing the credentials for this context. If the credential manager service is not configured to save credentials to the filesystem or if this context is not active, this method will return null.

Returns:
The name of the file containing the credentials for this context.

Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:

isActive

public boolean isActive()
Returns true if the associated credential is not null and is not yet expired.

Returns:
True if active, false otherwise

activate

public void activate(org.ietf.jgss.GSSCredential credential)
              throws CredentialException
Activates this context with the given credential. Throws an exception if the credential is null, if it is not active or if it is not accepted by this context (has an incorrect distinguished name, for example).

Parameters:
credential - The credential
Throws:
CredentialException

deactivate

public void deactivate()
Deactivates this credential context by nullifying the credential.
